page.title: 08HOUSING IN COXTIE GREEN
page.content: Coxtie Green is an elongated village to west of Pilgrims Hatch.Some of the houses date from the l7th Century e.g. Coxtie House and Nunns of l774.However most of the houses have been modernised.Most people work in Brentwood using their cars since the bus service is poor.The grain mill is now closed as is the telephone exchange which is now a car breaker's yard.The Peniel Academy opened in l982 is a private Pentecostal school. There are 3l pupils from 5-l8. The Coxtie Green Road is quite busy although it is narrow and residents complain about the lack of pavements. On Monday 28th June between 3p.m. and 3.30p.m. 2O cars passed westwards and 32 eastwards along it - mostly business men using the road as an alternative route to Romford.
